Wednesday October 15 - 07:00 PM to 08:30 PM

IU Cinema,1213 East 7th Street, Bloomington, IN 47406, USA

This WTIU-produced documentary examines the life and accomplishments of Major Taylor, the world‚Äôs first Black sports superstar and early civil rights pioneer. Taylor made his professional cycling debut in 1896 at the Six-Day Race held at New York‚Äôs famed Madison Square Garden; he was only 18 years o...

Wednesday October 15 - 07:00 PM to 08:00 PM

IU CINEMA

Produced by WTIU, this documentary retraces the life and legacy of an American civil rights pioneer who set more than 20 world records in track cycling during the heart of Jim Crow America. 04:00 PM
Twin Peaks Season 1, Episode 1 and 2 | IU Cinema
Twin Peaks Season 1, Episode 1 and 2 | IU Cinema

Sunday October 19 - 04:00 PM to 06:30 PM

U.S. Foreign Policy Between NATO and Russia

Wednesday October 29 - 04:00 PM to 05:00 PM

GLOBAL & INTERNATIONAL STUDIES BUILDING - Room Number: 1060

This talk examines how U.S. policy toward the Russia‚ÄìUkraine war has shifted between supporting Europe and Ukraine's security and deferring to Moscow's power. It shows how this tension has shaped Washington's use of sanctions, aid, and diplomacy.

REEI Colloquium: Josh Malitsky, "Cinematic Rubble, Modernity and Futurity: Yugoslav Nonfiction Imaginaries of the Post-WWII Era"

Friday October 31 - 02:00 PM to 03:00 PM

GLOBAL & INTERNATIONAL STUDIES BUILDING - Room Number: 4067

This talk will theorize the role of labor, rubble, and ruins in Yugoslav nonfiction film of the post WWII-era. In so doing, Malitsky aims to set a framework for thinking about the visualization of devastation and the temporal imaginaries it projects, marking its modernist alignments from more contem...
